message:
SA,
Do you normally store users' file uploads on the filesystem of your server, or you use an external file hosting service?

data.message: You can buy blob storage space separately on AWS S3 or Azure, it is much more scalable, and makes your server stateless, so you don't need to worry about hardware failure or losing customer's data
I would typically just store my uploads on the filesystem. Unless you happen to experience heavy traffic and/or serve critical content (where high availability is a must), then I would consider CDNs.
U should leave that to s3.

Usually the scalability category of the application and the hosting category tell you what to do.

If you are hosting in the cloud, you host your user files in a cloud file hosting service, called BLOB storage usually. No other option. 

If you host your application on multiple servers, even if not in the cloud, you host them somewhere else, because again, no option. Might be cloud or same data centre file server or even DB (kinda outdated option, and DBs aren't really optimised for it).

If you are hosting on one server because your app is that small, you can just host the files on the same server for ease. Hopefully you get periodic backups of the folder though, ideally automated.
